content: chain 3 counts as first double_crochet double_crochet into the same stitch top of the last double_crochet you made in the previous row chain 2 work 2 dcs into the center of the next scale chain 2 double_crochet between the 2 posts of the next set of dcs chain 2 work 2 dcs into the center of the next scale chain 2 work 2 dcs into the top of the chain 3 that you started the last row with you should have 5 sets of 2 dcs 6 turn the foundation row so that the top is now on your right chain 3 counts as first double_crochet work 4 dcs around the first post of the foundation row now turn the foundation row so that the top is on your left chain 1 work 5 dcs around the second post of the foundation row *chain 1 turn the foundation row once again so that the top is now on your right skip the next set of dcs work 5 dcs around the first post of the next set of dcs chain 1 now turn the foundation row so that the top is on your left work 5 dcs on the second post of this set of dcs * repeat from * to * til the end of the row turn the foundation row so that the top is back at the top you should have 1 more completed scale than your previous scale row 7 chain 3 counts as first double_crochet double_crochet into the same stitch top of the last double_crochet you made in the previous row chain 2 work 2 dcs into the center of the next scale chain 2 *double_crochet between the 2 dcs of the last set of double_crochet chain 2 work 2 dcs into the center of the next scale chain 2 * repeat from * to * til the end of the row work 2 dcs into the top of the chain 3 that you start the last row with you should have 2 more sets of 2 dcs than you did 2 row ago 8 repeat row 6 & 7 until you ve reached you desired size for the scarf i ended up with a final row of 16 scales at 34 across final row chain 1 half_double_crochet across the length of the scarf working 2 half_double_crochet along the post of each horizontal double_crochet 1 half_double_crochet into the center of each scale and 1 half_double_crochet around each skipped set of dcs tie off and weave in your ends fringe if you would like to add fringe to the point of your scarf like i did *cut 3 pieces of yarn that are about 5 each fold them in half forming a loop in the middle using your hook pull the loop through wherever you d like to add the fringe with the loop still on your hook yarn the ends over your hook and pull them through the loop * repeat from * to *
